node.statement: The q-deformed BLM model H_q = {Q_q, Q_q†}, constructed by replacing SU(2) Wigner 3j symbols with U_q(su(2)) quantum 3j symbols in the supercharge, defines a one-parameter family of N=2 SUSY quantum mechanical models (q > 0 real) exhibiting three distinct large-j geometric regimes: (I) q=1: Euclidean 3D gravity (Ponzano-Regge), melonic dominance, SYK-like SD equations; (II) fixed q > 0, q ≠ 1: breakdown of melonic dominance due to exponential growth of quantum 6j symbols governed by hyperbolic tetrahedron volumes (Volume Conjecture regime); (III) q = exp(2πi/r) root of unity: topological 3D gravity (Turaev-Viro / Chern-Simons at level k=r-2), with spin truncation j ≤ (r-2)/2.
